reference.scope: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.9 ANGSTROMS) OF 1-353 IN COMPLEX WITH RAT MAP1LC3B/LC3

comment.text: Cysteine protease required for the cytoplasm to vacuole transport (Cvt) and autophagy. Cleaves the C-terminal amino acid of ATG8 family proteins MAP1LC3, GABARAPL1, GABARAPL2 and GABARAP, to reveal a C-terminal glycine. Exposure of the glycine at the C-terminus is essential for ATG8 proteins conjugation to phosphatidylethanolamine (PE) and insertion to membranes, which is necessary for autophagy. Has also an activity of delipidating enzyme for the PE-conjugated forms.
Inhibited by N-ethylmaleimide. Redox-regulated during autophagy since reducing conditions activate ATG4A whereas an oxidizing environment such as the presence of H(2)O(2) inhibits its activity.
Mainly expressed in the skeletal muscle, followed by brain, heart, liver and pancreas.
Belongs to the peptidase C54 family.

property.value: Expressed in left lobe of thyroid gland and 236 other tissues
P:positive regulation of protein catabolic process

feature.description: Reduces the redox sensitivity and retains activity in presence of H(2)O(2).
